name: H10 Itaca Hotel

reviews.text: We had chosen this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. Overall, our stay was okay. We got to barcelona at 10:00 AM and they let us check in early which was nice. THe hotel is about 5-7 minute walk from the closest subway station and since there's nothing particularly special about the street its on, it can seem like a pretty long and boring walk. There doesn't seem to be air conditioning in the rooms so I can't imagine what styaing here would be like in the middle of summer. We did like the fact that there was two computers with internet connections in the lobby. It's in a pretty quiet area. There's a groccery store about a block away which is good if you want to pick up some water or snacks cheaply. I think we paid about 160 US per night which isn't the best deal. For that money, I think I'd prefer to stay somewhere a little closer to the main tourist areas and even a little closer to a subway station.
reviews.title: Not bad but it's a bit of a walk

reviews.text: Great hotel! Clean, modern, comfortable - it's conveniently located next to a major train station where you can find all the lines you need to get to the airport, city centre and sights on the outskirts of town (including Camp Nou for a football match). The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and they have a couple of computers you can use free of charge to surf the net. We preferred staying at this location to the hotels in the city centre which were in noisy and ultra - touristy areas. I would recommend H10 Itaca to anyone who is even a slightly independent traveler and is willing to spend a few minutes with a city street and public transport map. Plus there is a huge supermarket right next door that has a fantastic baked goods section that must be sampled!
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: This hotel is a little out of the centre, but great if you don’t mind a walk or want to use the near by metro or tourist bus stop, just a couple of minutes walk away. The standard rooms are very small (including the very small double bed) and I wouldn’t want to spend more then a couple of nights at the hotel, to offset this the marble bathrooms are lovely and go some way to make up for the small room.
reviews.title: Nice but not perfect

reviews.text: The worse part of my stay was having a room near the stairs, the noise of people coming and going at all hours kept me awake at times, also most of the rooms have wooden floors which do by there very nature make more noise the carpet when people walk on them.
reviews.title: Very good value for a nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotels good points are that it has clean rooms (all mod cons) and very friendly staff. The breakfast was great and would recommend paying the extra to eat at the hotel. Bad points are the paper thin walls, and location if you have limited mobility.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, wonderful breakfast, friendly staff

reviews.text: We checked Tripadvisor reviews for the H10 Itaca and, on the strength of the positive comments, we booked two rooms for us and for friends who were passing through Barcelona on their way home. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms, friendly helpful attitude of the staff and the variety and quality of the buffet breakfast. We also had a very nice late supper sitting outside on the terrace, which was most pleasant. The hotel is near the railway station, Sants, but a bit far from the centre. The metro is easy to use, however, and we had no problem getting around and seeing the sights. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: good hotel, great service
Fine Hotel but a beat far from centre
reviews.text: We are from Lisbon, Portugal
We liked the Hotel, but it´s a beat far from center. At night is ok, no noise. But if you want to dinner near by you dont have many choices, only small cafés.
reviews.title: Great Breakfasts!

reviews.text: Pleasant staff.
reviews.title: Very Noisy at Night

reviews.text: Rooms are well priced and very comfortable. The breakfasts were fantastic and although we didn't use the restaurant, the menus were varied and appeared to represent good value.
reviews.title: 5 star service

reviews.text: This hotel was quite simply perfect. From the friendly, English-speaking staff and the glass of complimentary Cava on arrival to the nicely-sized, well equiped rooms it was joy to stay at this hotel. I could not recommend this place highly enough for the reasonable mid-range cost. It is well situated, 5 minutes walk from the Estacio de Sants where train, metro, buses and taxis are continually available. From there a 5 minute metro ride had us in downtown Barcelona savouring the sights, sounds and tastes of this beautiful city.
reviews.title: what a treat
Disappointed, shower temperature was very inconsistent
reviews.text: Any request made of the hotel staff was dealt with speedily and with good grace. The restaurant menu looked very good but due to time constraints we never got to try their offerings. Each evening, snacks and free mineral water were always available to guests who retired to the canvas covered reception room - very chic.

The rooms were well-serviced but my only gripe would be the lack of a kettle and tea/coffee available in the rooms. There was a selection of self-heating drinks available which just seemed too odd and too instant for our liking. The fridge in the room also proved very useful.
reviews.title: good choice for midprice range

reviews.text: All in all, WHEN I return to Barcelona (very soon I hope) I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Thankyou TripAdvisor for introducing me this hotel in the first place.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.text: Nice hotel, but way too expensive for what you get. I would rather stay at the other hotel we were at in Barcelona that was half the cost and was not half the amenities. I expected more from H10, given that it was twice more expensive than the other hotel we are at earlier in the week. We stayed at H10 to splurge ourselves for our last night in Barcelona. H10 came way short. At close to the top of the list was that the best bed they could give us two twin beds pushed together rather than one queen or king bed. The absolute most disappointing part of our stay was the shower. The shower never held a constant temperature. It was either too hot or too cold, depending on whether someone else in the building was flushing a toilet or taking a shower at the same time. I have never experienced this problem of inconsistent shower temperature in any of my previous stays at any other hotel in the world. A comfortable shower has got to be one of the most important needs for a traveler, myself included. We were thoroughly disappointed.
reviews.title: Very Good...but some small things to be wary of......
Pretty good
reviews.text: This is a 2 minute walk from Sants train station in a very quiet area. Its only 5 minutes on the metro into central Barcelona. The room was spotlessly clean and well made up and the bathroom was the same. We asked for a larger room and didnt get one. It was quite small but there are much larger rooms. Try and push to get one. Breakfast was fine and decent - nothing spectacular and the staff were reasonably polite and helpful. It wont blow your socks off but it was a good experience.

reviews.title: Great Front Desk Staff
reviews.text: Hotel Stay January 24-29, 2007, H10 Itaca Barcelona. My wife and I, late 40s, experienced travellers, from Boston MA.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plusses: Very helpful and friendly front desk staff. They recommended excellent restaurants (Pexeirot, nearby; La Fonda del Port Olimpic, on the water several miles away), and were very responsive to some noise issues (baby constantly crying in room next door, rude young people talking and smoking in the hall outside our room at 3am). They moved us to a room away from the baby (hotel walls are quite thin and noise carries right through them), and spoke to the rude guests (as did I), who improved their behavior.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Take train from airport and walk 200 yards to hotel.

reviews.text: Breakfast is good (though in our opinion not as outstanding as some have indicated in their reviews), and service friendly.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay

reviews.text: Location was fine for us - near subway and train stations, a stop of the city tourist bus, and a large grocery store. Barcelona is quite large, and has many beautiful, wide boulevards. Our favorite attraction was the Conjunt Monumental de la Placa del Rei, just off Les Ramblas. It features a catwalk tour 'above' ruins of the old Roman city of Barcino - fascinating. The MNAC (National Museum), on the other hand, was a disappointment - but the building itself, and the views from it, are inspiring. The MNAC and Place Espanyol are a short walk from the hotel. The location felt safe to us as well, and we often walked in this area at night, and other areas of Barcelona, without incident.
reviews.title: Good but not 4 star

likes.disliked: — No kettle to make hot drinks

reviews.text: The hotel is slightly out of the old centre of Barcelona but is just a couple of hundred metres from the Metro and the main line that curves around past Montjuic and Las Ramblas along through Placa Catalunya. It's handily placed for sight seeing. Also, just a short 10 minute walk from Barcelona Sants train station, so easy to get to from the airport by train if you prefer.
reviews.title: Book this hotel and soak in the bath.....
Very good hotel
reviews.text: All in all, cracking value if you're not paying full price for the room and it won't disappoint. Prior to going, I read a review on here that it's noisy, but I found it no more noisy than most city centre hotels I've stayed in.

I decided to stay at the H10 Itaca on the recommendation of the reviews in tripadvisor.com and the great deal I got from Expedia. I was not disappointed. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms clean and well maintained. There have been some reports about the variable shower temperature but I did not experience it in the four nights I stayed there. Maybe they have fixed the problem or maybe I was just lucky. A reviewer also complained about the noisy ventillation system but again I did not find this a problem. The hotel staff set the ventillation on maximum boost as a default but you can switch it to low so that your sleep is not disturbed. However, you will experience some road noise as the hotel is on a main road but the double glazing ensures that this is not a significant problem.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: The hotel provide a wonderful buffet breakfast but at 14 euros it is quite expensive. You could eat in a nearby cafe but I decided to splash out and didn't regret it. The food is of the highest calibre and is enough to keep you going for most of the day.

I found the free access to the internet terminals quite useful where you could check your emails, the weather, timetables etc etc. And,you could stock up cheaply on supplies for the day from the supermarket right next door. This made the mini-bar rather superfluous.
reviews.title: Average stay at the Itaca

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is ideal if you are looking for somewhere away form the noise of the city centre and, dare I say it, the sort of guests who are likely to keep you awake all night. You could hear other guests, especially in the bathroom, but it was nothing to complain about. The location is also good if you are staying several nights and intend to take day trips to Stiges and Montserrat (both are worth it). Sants station is a stop for the Tourist Bus which costs 17 euros for one day and 21 euros for two days. As the tourist sites are well spaced apart, I would advise paying for this, especially if you are a first time visitor to Barcelona. Going independent, using the T tickets, is best done by those who know their way around.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable, good value (except for breakfast)

reviews.text: So, in conclusion, the H10 Itaca is an above average hotel which I thoroughly recommend. The only downside is that there is not much in the way of restaurants and entertainment in the area. However, it is easy to get into the city centre and then retreat to your hotel refuge at the end of the day. There is going to be a little walking involved (Sants station is 5 to 10 mins away) so if you are disabled or you are just plain lazy, you might prefer somewhere else. Also, if you are staying only a couple of nights you might find yourself better off at a city centre hotel like the H10 Universitat as you will want to see the main attractions quickly, but you must expect to pay a heavy price for this and your room is likely to be the size of a cupboard.
reviews.title: excellent, would stay again
Good Value
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights and found the hotel to be clean, modern and comfortable. As previously mentioned it is situated away from the centre of town and necessitated a 15 minute trip on the Metro to the Ramblas and port areas. We found the Breakfast to be fine and the room plenty big enough. The hotel is a five minute walk from Sants station which made it easy for connections to the airport and places further away such as Montserrat and Sitges. The staff were friendly and efficient which made a pleasent stay.
I got a good deal for 3 nights but would had preferred to pay more for a nicer hotel.
reviews.title: Not to repeat :(

reviews.text: When I got to my room it was so small that there was not even space to put a chair to use the desk to work. I requested a solution and they were very fast assigning me another room with more space and a chair!
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a Pretty Good Price

likes.disliked: — Location is a little bit far away from major attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet is fast but it has restrictions to access my work network. It’s the first time it happened to me. I could not use my email for 3 days… This is unacceptable.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.text: First nigh there were no black out curtains meaning that I could not sleep with the light. I asked for a protection for the eyes and they were very efficient providing it.
reviews.title: Better than you'd think

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not regard the H10 Itaca to be a 4-star hotel to international standards. Rooms and beds are small. Rooms range from 9 to 12 square metres. The smaller rooms do not even leave any space for a suitcase, as there is just enough space to walk around the bed and have no comfort chair or anything like it. The larger rooms (12 sq. m) do have a comfort chair and space to stow luggage. Double bed is just 1.50 x 1.90 m. Too short for many people. Sheets in stead of duvet. Airco really insufficient. Elevators extremely small , warm and clautrofobic. Breakfast buffet is rather fine and open until 11am in the summer season. Location is ok, but do not expect to be in the city center or near any restaurants.
reviews.title: 3 stars, not 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was everything I wanted. The location is not optimal for those who are on foot, but the main train/subway station, Sants-Estació, less than a 5 minute walk away and from there you can get anywhere in minutes. The staff spoke english very well and was extremely helpful and all areas of the hotel including the rooms were very clean. I especially liked the buffet breakfast which was a little pricey but had anything you would want for breakfast. I have stayed at a few different hotels in Barcelona and this was my favorite by far.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing.......if really pushed, would have been noce to be able to leave air con on whilst out.

reviews.text: Everything was excellent from the champagne on arrival to the rooftop jacuzzi (takes a bit of finding - up the stairs from the 7th floor and use your keycard in the door at the top).
reviews.title: Like noise - this is the hotel for you

likes.disliked: — the noise and no air conditiing

reviews.text: Spacious air conditioned rooms, free wifi & internet terminals, great buffet breakfast, and unusually for Barcelona, relatively quiet.
reviews.title: Hotel OK, noisy road

description: The H10 Itaca is ideally situated in the heart of the Eixample neighbourhood, very close to Sants Station (AVE) and the Montjuïc exhibition centre. You´ll be impressed by the hotel´s recent refurbishment with modern and innovative touches to the front entrance, Front Desk and Lobby Bar. The hotel´s new features include a plunge pool on the revamped Chill-Out Terrace and the Itaca Restaurant, which offers select signature cuisine in the evenings
